page.title: 10Clay Pipe Making, Crowedge
page.content: The {Halifax Old Seam of clay}is taken from open cast mines up to 150 ft. deep (the mine is back filled as the clay is worked out and very quickly reverts to good farmland). The seam is opprox. 15 ft. thick of which only the middle 5 ft. is pure enough for top quality pipes. The seam varies in chararter horizontally and clay from several mines is blended to produce a dense, vitrified and impervious body. Clay is also brought from the Midlands The extruded clay pipes, varying in size from 100mm diam. x 1500mm in length to 1m diam. x 3m in length and weighing up to two tons, are mainly fired in tunnel kilns heated to a final temperature of 1100 degrees C. by{North Sea Gas.}There is an immense stock of liquified gas for emergency use.{The company employs about 1000 {people}- a small number live locally.
